name: NPR
text:
Last month, the Ethiopian government launched a military offensive against a rebellious regional government. The ensuing conflict has killed hundreds, and almost 50,000 Ethiopians have crossed into Sudan.

Humanitarian workers are struggling to keep up.
https://t.co/h5TeVZUhJU

name: NPR
text: Opinion: It may seem elitist to worry about the future of the arts when so many people struggle for food, work and health care, @nprscottsimon says. But the arts can fire minds, warm souls, dazzle and delight. https://t.co/YzDKvdi7L8

name: NPR
text:
Economist Robert Reich served as secretary of labor under President Bill Clinton. @waitwait invited him to play "Secretary of Leisure" â€” 3 questions about things famous people do to relax.
https://t.co/VKjj912Ibj

name: NPR
text:
"Football players can get tests," one clinical pathologist said. "People choosing to socialize ... can get tests."

But a national program to test the nation's health care workers regularly? 

There isn't one.
https://t.co/J6DdqDMu4q

name: NPR
text:
After coming home from Iraq, Tyler's dad had nightmares so bad he feared closing his eyes. Tyler created a smartwatch app to detect their onset and disrupt them with a gentle vibration.

Now, it's FDA-approved to treat PTSD-related nightmare disorders. https://t.co/9o0z17Lx50
